There are several apps, websites, and digital tools I use on the daily that have enhanced my productivity levels significantly. History is not black and white. Its complicated. America was built on slave labor yet, blacks own slaves as well. The Republican Party was established to abolish slavery but most blacks vote Democrat. And sometimes, just sometimes, African kings marry white. No matter the race people are complicated, filled with contradictions and changed with the times. To view history through the lenses of today's culture cheats the learner of the full story. 

Black History Quiz is a newsletter shares facts you might not have learned in school and certainly did not learn from mainstream media. Black History Quiz educates, sparks debate and often puts history in a brand new light. Visit BlackHistoryQuiz.com and subscribe now. No matter your perspective of history, you will not be disappointed. BlackHistoryQuiz.com

African Americans; all ages.

NARSOL is proud to offer the Digest as the oldest regularly published journal focused on the expansion of sex offender registries in the United States and the individuals who are entangled in it. Started as an on-line newsletter in 2007, today‚Äôs Digest has grown up in every way. NARSOL now publishes four editions of the Digest that circulate bi-monthly.

‚Ä¢	The print edition is supported by hundreds of paid subscribers many of whom are incarcerated in state prisons for sexually based offenses. 
‚Ä¢	Our membership e-edition is published in the form of a preview to the online flipbook and is sent to members, donors, and supporters of our advocacy work. 
‚Ä¢	The full online flipbook is available to everyone through the Digest archives and is typically posted a week or two after the print edition has shipped. 
‚Ä¢	Finally, through the Federal Corrlinks program, currently many hundreds of federal prisoners receive a text-only e-edition. That number continues to grow monthly.
Summary - Short: Newsletter Digest of the National Association for Rational Sexual Offense Laws (NARSOL)

This newsletter is designed for regular people, not AI experts or Ph.D. holders, and will report how AI is affecting our daily experiences.

Side-stepping technical mumbo jumbo as far as possible, I examine the effects of AI on jobs and the workforce, and debate the ethics and moral dilemmas it represents. Rounding up will be a segment outlining the latest research in the field.

Our Newsletter can be characterized by the following: 

1. Current and Relevant: The newsletter delves into trending topics, especially those related to technology, social media, entertainment, and business.

2. Informative yet Engaging: While the primary aim is to inform readers about recent developments, it's not presented in a dull, straightforward manner. The language is playful, sprinkled with humor, and sometimes takes a cheeky tone.

3. Predictive and Forward-looking: The content often speculates about the future implications of current trends, suggesting what might be on the horizon.
